clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Probiotics on the Digestibility and Immunity in Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Probiotics on the Digestibility and Immunity in Infants

lead_sponsor.agency: Biostime Institute of Nutrition and Care

clinical_study.source: Biostime Institute of Nutrition and Care

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of the probiotic product on the GI tract flora composition.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Achieving the modulatory effect on the GI tract flora composition after the intervention.
primary_outcome.description: GI tract flora include Bifidobacterium, Lactobacillus, Clostridium perfringens, Enterococcus, Enterobacter, Bacteroides. Modulatory effect of GI tract flora composition was defined as two definitions. The first definition is that Lactobacillus and/or Bifidobacterium increases significantly, Clostridium perfringens decreases or has no change and Enterococcus, Enterobacter, Bacteroides has no obvious change. The other is that Lactobacillus and/or Bifidobacterium increases significantly, Clostridium perfringens decreases or has no change, Enterobacter and/or Enterococcus, Bacteroides increases significantly, but the amplification less than Lactobacillus/Bifidobacterium.
